did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of one Hollinger box and two oversize folders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Margaret Grattan Weaver Collection, Collection #2030, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: A parchment land patent dated 31 May 1753 to Gabriel Jones, signed by Robt. Dinwiddie, was donated to Carrier Library by Mrs. Margaret Grattan Weaver of Harrisonburg in October, 1986. It was framed using preservation methods and materials and hangs on the south wall in the Special Collections Room (Room 205). The remainder of the collection, received in February 1992, is on deposit from the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: John E. Roller, grandfather of Margaret G. Weaver, was born near Mt. Crawford in 1845, was a prominent lawyer, lecturer, and antiquarian in the Shenandoah Valley. He served in the Confederate Army, and in 1872 became major-general of the 3rd division of the Virginia militia. He also served as president of the Rockingham County Historical Society and pursued interests in local and religious history, amassing a considerable collection of books and papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a variety of documents relating to Mrs. Margaret G. Weaver and her ancestors, particularly her grandfather John E. Roller. Contained in this collection are a sampling of Roller's historical notes and speeches, some original documents relevant to local history, some Civil War materials, and a folder of genealogical data. A much larger collection of Roller family papers is located at the Virginia Historical Society in Richmond. The collection also contains genealogical information on the Grattan family, including a typescript of an autobiography (1849?) by Robert Grattan, and several essays by Margaret Grattan Weaver.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1. John E. Roller Papers. Series 2. Biographical/Genealogical Information. Series 3. Civil War Documents (incl. 2 groups of pamphlets). Series 4. Oversize.

did.unittitle: Historical notes, writings, & speeches in typescript, carbon, photocopy & autograph 1886-1891 but mostly undated

scopecontent.p: Includes data on town of Mt. Pleasant, Rockingham Circuit, German Element in VA, John Lederer, Hebron Lutheran (Madison Cty.), Reformed Churches, Robert Patton, Cap. Conway, R'ham Cty. Hist. Soc, & one of Roller's legal cases.

did.unittitle: Addresses. Typescripts, photocopies of printed programs, autograph drafts 1897-1910

scopecontent.p: On Jeff Davis, Huguenots, Reformed Churches, Civil War.
Notes on Roller's collection of catechisms; photocopies of exhibit & sale catalogs.

did.unittitle: Original documents signed by Peter Roler, E. Roller, Samuel Shaklett, Robert & John Grattan & others in Rockingham Cty 1779-1900 & undated

scopecontent.p: Includes bonds for collection of taxes, road petitions and certifications, deed, & indictment for permitting an insane slave to go at large.

did.unittitle: Thomas Harrison House: copy of registration form for National Register of Historic Places 1990
Writings of M. G. Weaver, including "A history of Inglewood Farm and its people," essays on history and religion 1976-1992 & undated

scopecontent.p: Includes genealogies, photocopies about JER, his 1918 obituary, and several invitations.
Includes 37 p. typescript autobiography of Maj. Robert Grattan (1770-1849) with details about life and school in Harrisonburg area.

Mostly receipts for supplies in Richmond area; also monthly summary of funds, report on Richmond defences (June 1863 from H. Douglis to Col. Stevens), some personal notes concerning arms, transportation, & personnel; pieces of Merrimac and U.S. Cumberland.
7 letters between J.C. Ingram & his mother; other misc. letters, incl. one 1894 from Mrs. Stonewall Jackson.
about the Civil War, incl. Battle of New Market, Southern & Confederate States almanacs, address by Gen. Early, a report by Maj.-Gen. Magruder, & Fredericksburg Battlefield map.
annual addresses by Charles C. Jones Jr. to Confederate Survivors' Assn.

to Gabriel Jones for 644 acres "on the north side of Shannando" in Augusta Cty. (now near Port Republic in Rockingham Cty.) signed by Rob(er)t Dinwiddie, Lieut. Gov. of VA. Original hanging on wall of Spec. Coll. room.
2 indentures signed 1780 by Peter Roler, 1 Latin document, one sheet with signatures pasted on both sides (incl. R.E.Lee & other military leaders), & 2 unidentified photos of female academy classes.

arrangement.p: These signatures were removed from their backing, deacidified, remounted with wheat paste on acid free backing, and encapsulated by Conservator Yolanda Warren in March 1993.
